events.name: May GDG Meetup

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
Our monthly meetups are open to the public. We feature talks, workshops, open discussions, and more that focus on development strategies relating to Google developer products. 

We welcome developers from the community to host talks or workshops with our group.

Typical meetup format :

5:00 - Keynote 
5:20 -  Main talk 
5:30 - Open discussion 
6:00 - Wrap up

"Google Developer Groups (GDGs) are for developers who are interested in Google's developer technology; everything from the Android, Chrome, Drive, and Google Cloud platforms, to product APIs like the Cast API, Maps API, and YouTube API. A GDG can take many forms -- from just a few people getting together to watch our latest video, to large gatherings with demos and tech talks, to events like code sprints and hackathons. However, at the core, GDGs are focused on developers and technical content, and the core audience should be developers."

events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Jalandhar

venue.name: Thapar University
venue.address_1: Patiala

events.description:
About I/O

Google I/O is an annual developer festival held at the outdoor Shoreline Amphitheatre. Each year, Google I/O provides a huge quantity of educational videos, code labs, and blog posts to help developers keep up with the latest in technology. 

This event will showcase some of the major announcements from I/O, in-person experiences and insider information from developers who were there, and provide access to hands-on code labs so that developers can try out the new technology!

About I/O Extended 

I/O Extended events include a variety of options for developers—from live streaming sessions to local demos, hackathons, code-labs, and more. 

GDG Jalandhar has been doing I/O Extended event in Punjab from the last Six years.We are bringing to you another version of the I/O Extended. Our first meetup on meetup.com. Come out and join us for a day full of fun and meaningful sessions.

This event will have pizza and beverages provided by a sponsorship from Google Developers. There may also be some swag. If you are interested in sponsoring  please contact us at [masked]

Agenda

10.30 – 10.45 AM                       Google Keynote

10.45 – 11.30 AM                        What’s new In Android

11:30 – 01:00 AM                       What’s new in Web (PWA & Polymer)

01:00 – 02:00 PM                      Lunch and Networking

02:00 – 03:00 PM                     Intro to Firebase and PWA (Code Labs)      

03.00 - 03.30 PM                      Intro to Kotlin 

03.30 - 04.00 PM                      Data Mining with Google Analytics     

04.00 - 04.30 PM                      Closing Note & Goodies Distribution

Venue :   Tan Audi, Thapar University, Patiala

events.name: Make with Google

venue.name: DAV Institute of Engineering & Technology
venue.address_1: Kabir Nagar, Jalandhar, Punjab 144008

events.description:
Make with Google is an event where novice developer gets together to watch and explore the Google Products. This event includes varieties of options for developers— to know the logic and working of Google Search, Maps & how Google Home provides us Hands-free help from the Google Assistant. Learn how to work smarter using Google Docs, Sheets, Slides by editing and sharing your documents from anywhere. GDG Jalandhar has been doing Make with Google event in Punjab from the last Seven years. We are bringing to you another version of the Make with Google. This event will showcase some of the major announcements from I/O, in-person experiences and insider information from developers who were there, and provide access to hands-on code labs so that developers can try out the new technology. Come out and join us for a day full of fun and meaningful sessions. The focus of the workshop is materializing an integrated community of developers making it easy for everyone to reach out and help each other in their future endeavors.

Agenda

• Google Search Techniques

• Build your Career with Google 

• Google Developers Products Showcase

• Take your certification with Google 

Time: 9 am to 12 pm

Venue: DAVIET Jalandhar, Punjab 

Website: www.gdgjalandhar.com 

Mail: [masked]  

Google Developer Site: https://developers.google.com/groups/chapter/114790565755036483829/ 

Contact Number: [masked], [masked]

events.name: GDG Jalandhar RoadShow

venue.name: Chandigarh University
venue.address_1: National Highway 95, Chandigarh-Ludhiana Highway, Mohali, Punjab 140413

events.description:
GDG Jalandhar Roadshow is an event where the developer gets together to watch and explore the upcoming and existing technology. Roadshow aims to bring together a mix of Google practitioners from industry experts, academic researchers, data scientists and self-taught individuals to help learn, discover and build. GDG Jalandhar Roadshow is large, community-run events that can offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, all-day hack-a-thons, code labs, and more. The hackathon will be focused on three areas, Mobile, Web and Internet of Things(IoT). Come out and join us for a day full of fun and meaningful sessions. The focus of the workshop is materializing an integrated community of developers making it easy for everyone to reach out and help each other in their future endeavors.  

Agenda

• What’s new In Mobile App Development 

• Machine Learning & Tensor Flow

• Intro to Firebase & PWA 

• Intro to Google Cloud

• Career with Google 

• Fireside Chat on WTM

Time: 9 am to 4.30 pm

Date: 14 Oct 2017

Venue: Chandigarh University, Punjab 

Entry Fees: 200/-

More Info: http://gdgjalandhar.com/RoadShow/

events.name: GDG DevFest 2017

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
GDG DevFest is a great opportunity to learn more about Google technologies and developer products. The events also give one a chance to meet developer advocates and engineers who work on these products and ask them any questions one might have. GDG Jalandhar is once again hosting developer conference named "GDG DevFest 17" at Punjab. The conference aims at bringing together Google technology enthusiasts of all experience levels, from new users to core developers. DevFests are organized by Google and supported by Google Developer Group. "DevFest" provides a platform for companies who are looking for developers to interact with and get involved with the developer community of Google as well as a great chance to connect with so many talented developers will join us from around the world. The conference will consist of cool and vivacious events and will concentrate on "Everyday Google" and will contain talks and discussions by developers on Google technologies used in everyday life like Android, Chrome, Cloud etc. Technologies like AR/VR, HTML 5, Google App Engine, Electronic devices using Android etc. will also be discussed by core developers already working or interested in working with Google APIs. The focus of the conference is materializing an integrated community of developers making it easy for everyone to reach out and help each other in their future endeavors. 

Agenda

1.  Welcome Note

2.  Whats new in Android and Web

3.  Intro to Machine Learning and Tensorflow

4.  Firebase and FireStore

5.  Tracks (Web/Mobile/Cloud)

6.  Firesides Chat with WTM & Tech Leaders

Web Track

->UiI/ UX with Material Design

-> AMP & PWA (Code-Labs)

MobileTrack

-> Instant Apps Development 

-> Kotlin (Code-Labs)

Cloud Track

-> Google Cloud

-> Firebase for Web (Code-Labs)

Speakers:

1. Mr. Rahul Pandey, Global Google Student Ambassador at Google India

2. Mr. Kamal Vaid, Android Developer at Infosys

3. Mr. Anupinder Singh, Lead – Google Educator Group Chandigarh  

4. Mr. Namit Pathak, Salesforce Developer at Cognizant  

5. Mr. Ashwdeep Shekhawat, CEO at IntegerHost & Director at VentureHeap

6. Mr. Prateek Rana, Google Certified Associate Android Developer & Android Facilitator

7. Mr. Tanay Khanna, Google Certified Associate Android Developer & UI/UX Specialist

8. Ms. Nitika Pratham Bhatia, Lead at WTM Jalandhar & GDG Jalandhar

More Info: http://devfest17.gdgjalandhar.com/
Website: http://www.gdgjalandhar.com
Mail: [masked]
Google Developer Site: https://developers.google.com/groups/chapter/114790565755036483829/
Contact Number: [masked], [masked]

events.description:
• What we'll do
GDG-WTM Meetup is an event and global opportunity where developers get together to learn about code and get to know about Google Developer Community. This community provides visibility, community, and resources for everyone in technology to drive innovation and participation in the field. This event is designed to promote an environment inclusivity for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading contributions in the industry. Our aim is to promote gender equality in this dynamic field of technology and giving more confidence and exposure to enthusiast women. Women Techmakers raises awareness of innovative women leaders in technology and inspires others to join the field

Laptops

venue.name: Infosys Chandigarh

events.description:
Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high-quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.

For those who missed the awesome Google Developer Days at Bengaluru, we've got some exciting news! GDD India Extended Jalandhar is scheduled on 3rd Feb 2018.

*****
We will send the confirmation mail by 1st Feb 2018.
*****

1) GDG Intro & other Google Developers Programs
2) Whats new in ML & Tools available
3) Generating efficient APK by reducing the size and improving performance

6) Instant Apps

events.name: Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
• What we'll do
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give your community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

Topics
1) Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
2) Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.

Venue: Lovely Professional University
Date: 17 Feb 2018
Time: 9:00 am to 2:00 pm

Contact Info:

Mail: [masked]
Website: www.gdgjalandhar.com

• What to bring
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn something in person. These trainings will give your community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

The objective of Study Jams is to raise the technical proficiency of our global community members through the highest possible course completion rate.

• Important to know
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

events.name: Mobile Site Certification Study Jams

venue.name: Google Hangout
venue.address_1: Google Hangout

events.description:
• What we'll do
The Mobile Sites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognises them as an expert in mobile sites. You can earn the certification through Academy for Ads, Google's online training programme.

Many people learn better when they learn in groups. Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers covering a range of Google Developers content. Typically, Study Jams focus on completing a course, but some may focus on mastering a skill or product area.
The Study Jams objective is to raise the technical proficiency of global community members through the highest possible course completion rate.

** We will share the Google Hangout Invitation by 3.45 PM on 10 March.

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

events.name: IWD 18 | GDG - WTM Jalandhar

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
• What we'll do
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation toward women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

People of all genders are welcome to attend our event. As always, we try to focus on the accomplishments of technologists that also happen to be women, rather than just focusing on the story of doing something as a woman. We aim to keep things positive when selecting panels, talks, keynotes, etc.

What to Expect
-------------------------------------------------------------
A Session Full of Tech, Fun Activities and Success Stories of women in the various field. At this IWD’18 we will focus on two technologies i.e Google Assistant & Firebase, after this, you will be able to make apps on Assistant for the various problem. Apart from this, we have Pizzas, Coke & Some Goodies too.

Details: https://gdgjalandhar.com/events/iwd18/

Complete Details will be updated soon....

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

About Women Techmakers Jalandhar
Women Techmakers is Google's global program designed to provide visibility, community and resources for women in technology. Its goal is to showcase the work of women in the technology industry by providing a platform to celebrate their talents and spotlight role models.
A special community called WTM Jalandhar has been founded for girls to bridge the gap between women who are eager to lay their hands on the latest technology.

events.name: Machine Learning Study Jams

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
• What we'll do
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of our community together to learn something new or advance their knowledge, with the help of a community facilitator. Skills learnt in this workshop can be used for personal development or career advancement.

As a complement to large tech talks and viewing party events that you may already be hosting, the Machine Learning Study Jam framework brings together a small group of your members who are interested in learning about Machine Learning Crash Course. Join us for a Machine Learning Study Jam where we will run through the Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC)!

This course is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable you to use machine learning in your everyday projects and learn about the power of TensorFlow. This is a great opportunity for anyone with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

Machine Learning Crash Course (MLCC) is intended for those who wish to learn about ML from a practical, applied perspective that will enable them to use machine learning within their everyday projects, and who wish to benefit from the power of TensorFlow wrapped in convenient higher-level abstractions.
This is a great opportunity for audience with basic technical knowledge and limited Machine Learning knowledge willing to gain some practical experience in ML and TensorFlow.

Where?[masked] LPU
When? 1st April, 9 AM TO 1 PM

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know

events.name: Build Actions for your Community

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
• What we'll do
Venue:[masked], LPU
Time: 9.00 am to 2.00 pm

Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

**More Details will be updated soon...

“Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to community organizers worldwide. You can offer opportunities to developers attending your events to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, they can build something in an area that they care about or are interested in. Contact:
Website: gdgjalandhar.com
Mail: [masked]

• What to bring
Laptop

• Important to know
GDG Jalandhar Code of conduct

When you join our Community, you’re joining a Member. And like any growing community, a few ground rules about expected behavior are good for everyone. These guidelines cover both online (e.g. mailing lists, social channels) and offline (e.g. in-person meetups) behavior.

Violations of this code of conduct can result in members being removed from the Community. Use your best judgement, and if you’d like more clarity or have questions feel free to reach out.

events.name: Google IO Extended'18

venue.name: Thapar University
venue.address_1: Patiala

events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and the first look at Google’s latest developer products.

Thapar University | 9th June 2018 | 9.30 AM to 5.30 PM
#IO18Extended #GDGJalandhar #GDGJalandhar

Speakers:
* Kamal Vaid (Infosys)
* Tushar Srivastava (Infosys)
* Anupinder Singh (GEG Lead)
* Vrijraj Singh (GDG)
* Suraj Kumar (GDG)
* Sonakshi Shukla (WTM)
* Varsha Jaiswal (GDG)
* Shiv Prakash (GDG)

Primary Agenda:
• Action on Google for Solving Business Problems
• Getting started with Flutter
• Exploring Google Cloud ML
• Build Web app with Firebase
• Making web faster with PWA
• Daydreams and Google Maps
• Whats New in Android

events.name: Flutter Study Jams v1
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.
Check out: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

WHy?
Study Jams are a great opportunity to bring members of the community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

events.description: Build Actions with GDG is an open and modular event series designed by GDG and offered to community organizers worldwide. You can offer opportunities to developers attending your events to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, they can build something in an area that they care about or are interested in. The conference will consist of cool and vibrant events and will concentrate on "Everyday Google" and will contain talks and discussions by developers on Google technologies used in everyday life like Google Assistant, Firebase, etc. It will also be discussed by core developers already working or interested in working with the Developers team. events.name: Build with Angular

venue.name: Lovely Professional University
venue.address_1: Jalandhar-Delhi G.T. Road, National Highway 1, Phagwara, Punjab 144411

events.description:
Software development industry is evolving every day, If we talk about building web-based software we need to use different languages and frameworks to make a highly efficient product. Angular is a superheroic framework developed by Google to build great web applications, apart from being backed by Google it has great developer ecosystem and great market demand. Build with Angular is a great opportunity for engineering students to learn a technology which is in very high demand.

Agenda timeline
Day 1:
- JavaScript Fundamentals
- JavaScript & TypeScript Essentials
- Basics overview of the software development process.
- Basics of Client Server application architecture.
- Fundamental of Angular.
- Building Blocks of an Angular Application.
- Building a single page app.

Day 2:
- Setting Angular with GitHub.
- Building a real-world production ready angular app and deploy it to live server.
- Brainstorming Session and unlocking Industry Secrets.
- Experience Sharing.

events.name: Cloud Study Jams 2019

venue.name: Apeejay Institute of Engineering under Apeejay Institute of Management Technical Campus
venue.address_1: NH70, Rama Mandi,Hoshiarpur Road, Jalandhar, Punjab 144007

events.description:
Study Jams are community-run study groups for developers. This is a great opportunity to bring members of the community together to learn something in person. These training will give the community members a specific skill they can use for personal development or career advancement.

With a Cloud Study Jam, you will learn the fundamental tools and capabilities of Google Cloud. Attendees will receive free access to our online labs. You can choose any of our recommended tracks to run with the community: Machine Learning, Kubernetes, Certification, IoT, and Security.
After the session, attendees can continue taking labs to earn Google Cloud badges.

At the event, we’ll use a tool called Qwiklabs, a Google training product.

If you have used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at:
https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up
(creating an account is free).

At the event, we will give you a link for free Qwiklabs access. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos! That makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

Agenda
1. Intro to GCP
2. Google App Engine
3. Web App Deployment using Google App Engine

Speaker Name:
1. Vrijraj Singh
2. Rohan Singh
3. Nitish Kumar Singh

events.name: IWD Jalandhar 2019

venue.name: Apeejay Institute of Engineering under Apeejay Institute of Management Technical Campus
venue.address_1: NH70, Rama Mandi,Hoshiarpur Road, Jalandhar, Punjab 144007

events.description:
International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation for women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

Women Techmakers is a program created by Google to celebrate International Women's Day and to highlight the talent of women in technology. In 2019, we’re organizing the fourth edition in Montreal as part of the special event The Women Techmakers Global Event Series Celebrating International Women’s Day (WTM IWD).

Speaker Name:
1. Siddhant Agarwal (Google)
2. Sonakshi Shukla (VentureHeap)

4. Varsha Jaiswal (iB Hubs)

Theme: Lift as you Climb

1. I'm Remarkable Workshop

#IWD #IWD19 #IWDJalandhar

events.name: UX & Product engineering like a Pro
events.description:
World-Class Products like Flipkart, Uber, Hotstar are not made in a day, they are made by the efforts of many people which includes UX, Engineering, Products, and other segments. with time these products are grown up and becoming better, user friendly and feature-rich in newer versions. But the question is how they are doing it? How they are understanding the requirements of millions of users and implementing in such a way that it satisfies the needs of most of the users.

Here Product Engineering plays a vital role in Growth of Product, In this webinar, we are going the following things:-
1. Why UX is the most important thing?
2. Thinking UX Beyond Colors, design and animations.
3. Understanding User behaviors and needs.
4. Product planning and management from ground zero by leveraging tools like Design thinking and Inclusive design patterns.
5. Engineering Management Strategies for most fruitful result in less time, cost and efforts
6. A/B Testing and migration strategy from older technology stack to newer technology stack without compromising the performance and application uptime

Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5_eeeegJKmI

events.name: SEO : How it works?
events.description:
SEO stands for search engine optimization. Which is the art of ranking high on a search engine in the unpaid section, also known as the organic listings.
In this session we will discuss:
1) How SEO works?
2) How to make your webpage SEO friendly?

events.name: Build your career with Google Cloud
events.description:
Webinar on Google Cloud, you will learn the fundamental tools and capabilities of Google Cloud.

Speakers:
1. Chirag Nayyar
2. Rohan Singh

events.name: The Art of AR
events.description:
Augmented Reality (AR) will fundamentally change the way we interact with our environment by enhancing the way we perceive the world. It represents a merging of the physical and the digital domains into a rich, context-aware, and accessible user interface delivered in real-time through a socially acceptable form factor, such as eyeglasses. AR has the potential to greatly expand the frontiers of human experience, opening new unexplored areas of interdisciplinary applications spanning entertainment, education, medical, industrial, and others. But to realize that potential, key challenges such as managing power consumption and determining an acceptable thermal envelope must be addressed.

In this webinar, we will discuss the basics of AR and will also talk about how the "Google 3D animal" feature works.

#GDGJalandhar #WTMJalandhar #Webinar #AR

events.name: Accelerate your development pace using VS Code features
events.description: In this webinar, you are going to deep dive into the VS Code features which will ultimately speed up the development cycle. In VS Code, there are various features and plugins which are used by pro developers to speed up their development pace.

events.name: Interview prep  Vs Competitive coding
events.description:
Confused about how to start with the coding/problem-solving skills for top MNCs and crack the interviews of your dream company? Or Stucked with how to start for competitive coding for ICPC, Hacker Cup, Kick Start, or Code Jam, etc?

Here is the right place to ask all your doubts and queries. Shubhangi will talk about the basic steps which you can take to enhance your skills.

#GDGJalandhar #WTMJalandhar #Webinar

events.name: Web Assembly
events.description:
In this webinar we will be giving you a brief introduction about what Web Assembly is. We will cover:
- What is Web Assembly
- Why do we need it
- What is the scope of it / Possibilities with Web Assembly

upcoming.name: IWD India 2020
upcoming.description:
" Rise, awake, and do not stop until you reach your aim ." - Swami Vivekananda

For the first time ever, 35 communities across the country are coming together to host a combined online summit to conduct inspiring sessions, tech talks, and fun activities for you. The summit had Industry Leaders, Google Developer Experts, Entrepreneurs, and Community Leaders talking about the latest in tech, design, entrepreneurship, and leadership.

International women's day has been celebrated for years. With a devotion to women, we Women Techmakers, Jalandhar along with fellow Women Techmakers communities want to accomplish a huge tech revolution with growing women in tech. Since the era of rationalized culture impacted doting together in the work field. The community has brought the change and accelerate their careers in STEM. We have seen them as a better companion in every odyssey. A day to make them realize they can rise, as brighten as the sun, as glorious as stars. A step could make bolder and stronger. We, want you to rise with sun and outreach far and away.

May 23rd, 24th, 30th, 31st | 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM IST

For event details and to register, visit: goo.gle/wtmindia-iwd20
Follow @WTMIndia and @WTMJalandhar on twitter for latest updates.

#TogetherWeRise
#IWDIndia2020
#WTM20

organizers.name: Vrijraj S.
organizers.bio: Always eager to learn new technologies and develop new things based on it. Thinking out of the box is what I believe in doing.

group_profile.title: Google Developers Expert for Web
group_profile.intro: I believe learning is a process that never stops, even though you may become old enough there are things that you can still learn.A simple nature and simple choices, dream of the stars with feet on the ground.
I feel there is always a scope of learning. My name is Sonakshi . I am a "Web developer". Believe in working and helping people in all the possible way.

organizers.name: Varsha J.
organizers.bio: "Enthusiasm to Learn" defines me in a nutshell. Aiming towards the goal and keeping continuous effort to achieve the same is what I believe. I'm girl who puts each step thinking about giving back to the society by sharing the knowledge with everyone.

group_profile.title: Women Techmakers Ambassador
group_profile.intro: A keen-learner and love to implement new technologies.
